20110106154823.000|20110106154825.000|TR0|
20110106154825.000|20110106154827.000|TR0|INSLEE:  Thank you.
20110106154827.000|20110106154828.000|TR0|
20110106154828.000|20110106154830.000|TR0|Mr. Goodlatte, could you explain to us the 
20110106154830.000|20110106154832.000|TR0|decision-making process about which 
20110106154832.000|20110106154834.000|TR0|language to read today?  And the reason I 
20110106154834.000|20110106154836.000|TR0|ask is, through American history, we had a 
20110106154836.000|20110106154837.000|TR0|series of amendments that were intended to 
20110106154837.000|20110106154839.000|TR0|change the original document.  But the 
20110106154839.000|20110106154841.000|TR0|amendments do not make specific deletions 
20110106154841.000|20110106154843.000|TR0|to specific language in the original 
20110106154843.000|20110106154845.000|TR0|document. And it's been up to us to 
20110106154845.000|20110106154846.000|TR0|ascertain the intent of the amendments to 
20110106154846.000|20110106154848.000|TR0|figure out which language is operative or 
20110106154848.000|20110106154850.000|TR0|not.
20110106154850.000|20110106154852.000|TR0|
20110106154852.000|20110106154853.000|TR0|But the language has not specifically been 
20110106154853.000|20110106154855.000|TR0|deleted by the amendments, so it could be 
20110106154855.000|20110106154857.000|TR0|subject to some interpretation of which 
20110106154857.000|20110106154859.000|TR0|language really has been removed and which 
20110106154859.000|20110106154901.000|TR0|has not.  And so I think it would be 
20110106154901.000|20110106154902.000|TR0|helpful to the members if you explain to 
20110106154902.000|20110106154904.000|TR0|us how the determinations of what to read 
20110106154904.000|20110106154906.000|TR0|has been made or not made, so that we will 
20110106154906.000|20110106154908.000|TR0|all be on the same page as to 
20110106154908.000|20110106154910.000|TR0|congressional intent.
20110106154910.000|20110106154911.000|TR0|
20110106154911.000|20110106154913.000|TR0|REP. ROBERT GOODLATTE (R), VIRGINIA:  I 
20110106154913.000|20110106154915.000|TR0|thank the gentleman for his question.
20110106154915.000|20110106154917.000|TR0|
20110106154917.000|20110106154918.000|TR0|We have consulted with the Congressional 
20110106154918.000|20110106154920.000|TR0|Research Service, of the Library of 
20110106154920.000|20110106154922.000|TR0|Congress.  The Library of Congress 
20110106154922.000|20110106154924.000|TR0|actually maintains a copy of the 
20110106154924.000|20110106154926.000|TR0|Constitution which includes those sections 
20110106154926.000|20110106154927.000|TR0|that have been superceded by amendment.  
20110106154927.000|20110106154929.000|TR0|So we are not reading those sections that 
20110106154929.000|20110106154931.000|TR0|have been superceded by amendment, and we 
20110106154931.000|20110106154933.000|TR0|have arrived at that determination based 
20110106154933.000|20110106154935.000|TR0|upon our consultation with the 
20110106154935.000|20110106154936.000|TR0|Congressional Research Service.
20110106154936.000|20110106154938.000|TR0|
20110106154938.000|20110106154940.000|TR0|INSLEE:  And would the gentleman accept 
20110106154940.000|20110106154942.000|TR0|the premise that since we have not been 
20110106154942.000|20110106154943.000|TR0|able to review the exact language we will 
20110106154943.000|20110106154945.000|TR0|be reading today, that this is not -- this 
20110106154945.000|20110106154947.000|TR0|is not -- thank you, gentlemen.
20110106154947.000|20110106154949.000|TR0|
20110106154949.000|20110106154951.000|TR0|But, Mr. Goodlatte -- I'll wait for a 
20110106154951.000|20110106154952.000|TR0|moment, Mr. Speaker.  Thank you.
20110106154952.000|20110106154954.000|TR0|
20110106154954.000|20110106154956.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  The House will be in 
20110106154956.000|20110106154958.000|TR0|order.
20110106154958.000|20110106155000.000|TR0|
20110106155000.000|20110106155001.000|TR0|INSLEE:  We do want to have a good 
20110106155001.000|20110106155003.000|TR0|bipartisan success here today. And this is 
20110106155003.000|20110106155005.000|TR0|a special moment for us all.
20110106155005.000|20110106155007.000|TR0|
20110106155007.000|20110106155008.000|TR0|So I guess the question is, I take it 
20110106155008.000|20110106155010.000|TR0|since we have not had discussion about 
20110106155010.000|20110106155012.000|TR0|which language to read or not, that this 
20110106155012.000|20110106155014.000|TR0|is not intended to create any statement of 
20110106155014.000|20110106155016.000|TR0|congressional intent about the language, 
20110106155016.000|20110106155017.000|TR0|but rather to do our best to have a moment 
20110106155017.000|20110106155019.000|TR0|of comity to read the language as best as 
20110106155019.000|20110106155021.000|TR0|we can ascertain it.
20110106155021.000|20110106155023.000|TR0|
20110106155023.000|20110106155025.000|TR0|Is that correct?
20110106155025.000|20110106155026.000|TR0|
20110106155026.000|20110106155028.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I think the gentleman has 
20110106155028.000|20110106155030.000|TR0|stated that very well.
20110106155030.000|20110106155032.000|TR0|
20110106155032.000|20110106155033.000|TR0|INSLEE:  Thank you.  And I very much 
20110106155033.000|20110106155035.000|TR0|appreciate your leadership and bringing 
20110106155035.000|20110106155037.000|TR0|this to our attention today.  Thank you.

20110106155116.000|20110106155118.000|TR0|
20110106155118.000|20110106155120.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  Does the gentleman 
20110106155120.000|20110106155122.000|TR0|from Virginia yield for that purpose?
20110106155122.000|20110106155123.000|TR0|
20110106155123.000|20110106155125.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I yield.
20110106155125.000|20110106155127.000|TR0|
20110106155127.000|20110106155129.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  The gentleman yields.
20110106155129.000|20110106155131.000|TR0|
20110106155131.000|20110106155132.000|TR0|JACKSON:  I thank the gentleman for his 
20110106155132.000|20110106155134.000|TR0|kindness.
20110106155134.000|20110106155136.000|TR0|
20110106155136.000|20110106155138.000|TR0|Let me first begin by saying that I think 
20110106155138.000|20110106155140.000|TR0|every member of this body is approaching 
20110106155140.000|20110106155141.000|TR0|the reading of their Constitution with the 
20110106155141.000|20110106155143.000|TR0|most sacred possible spirit in what is 
20110106155143.000|20110106155145.000|TR0|clearly an unprecedented moment in the 
20110106155145.000|20110106155147.000|TR0|history of the Congress of the United 
20110106155147.000|20110106155148.000|TR0|States.  And I don't take it very lightly 
20110106155148.000|20110106155150.000|TR0|when my colleague or when others, before 
20110106155150.000|20110106155152.000|TR0|we begin the reading of our sacred 
20110106155152.000|20110106155154.000|TR0|document, are raising questions about what 
20110106155154.000|20110106155156.000|TR0|we will specifically be reading, what 
20110106155156.000|20110106155157.000|TR0|specifically will be dedacted based upon 
20110106155157.000|20110106155159.000|TR0|amendments, or based upon the 
20110106155159.000|20110106155201.000|TR0|recommendations of Libraries of Congress.
20110106155201.000|20110106155203.000|TR0|
20110106155203.000|20110106155205.000|TR0|But I want to be clear, Mr. Speaker and 
20110106155205.000|20110106155206.000|TR0|Mr. Goodlatte -- I recognize that this is 
20110106155206.000|20110106155208.000|TR0|a request -- that in reading those 
20110106155208.000|20110106155210.000|TR0|dedacted -- this is very emotional for me. 
20110106155210.000|20110106155212.000|TR0| It's very emotional for, I know, a number 
20110106155212.000|20110106155213.000|TR0|of members given the struggle.  And I'm 
20110106155213.000|20110106155215.000|TR0|not trying to take a shot at the process.  
20110106155215.000|20110106155217.000|TR0|And Mr. Goodlatte knows me and he knows 
20110106155217.000|20110106155219.000|TR0|the spirit with which I am approaching 
20110106155219.000|20110106155221.000|TR0|this.
20110106155221.000|20110106155222.000|TR0|
20110106155222.000|20110106155224.000|TR0|Given the struggle of African-Americans, 
20110106155224.000|20110106155226.000|TR0|given the struggle of women, given the 
20110106155226.000|20110106155228.000|TR0|struggle of others to create a more 
20110106155228.000|20110106155230.000|TR0|perfect document -- while not perfect, a 
20110106155230.000|20110106155231.000|TR0|more perfect document to hear that those 
20110106155231.000|20110106155233.000|TR0|elements of the Constitution that have 
20110106155233.000|20110106155235.000|TR0|been dedacted by amendment are no less 
20110106155235.000|20110106155237.000|TR0|serious, no less part of our ongoing 
20110106155237.000|20110106155238.000|TR0|struggle to improve the country and to 
20110106155238.000|20110106155240.000|TR0|make the country better, and are sense in 
20110106155240.000|20110106155242.000|TR0|our struggle in whom we are at the 
20110106155242.000|20110106155244.000|TR0|Congress of the United States, at this 
20110106155244.000|20110106155246.000|TR0|point in American history, and our desire 
20110106155246.000|20110106155247.000|TR0|to continue to improve the Constitution, 
20110106155247.000|20110106155249.000|TR0|many of us don't want that to be lost upon 
20110106155249.000|20110106155251.000|TR0|the reading of our sacred document.
20110106155251.000|20110106155253.000|TR0|
20110106155253.000|20110106155255.000|TR0|And so with that said, I thank the 
20110106155255.000|20110106155256.000|TR0|gentleman for yielding.  And I just wanted 
20110106155256.000|20110106155258.000|TR0|to indicate that this is done with 
20110106155258.000|20110106155300.000|TR0|sincerity.  It is not to take a shot at 
20110106155300.000|20110106155302.000|TR0|the idea of reading the Constitution.  But 
20110106155302.000|20110106155303.000|TR0|certainly when we were informed, for 
20110106155303.000|20110106155305.000|TR0|example, that the three-fifths clause 
20110106155305.000|20110106155307.000|TR0|would not be mentioned, and that other 
20110106155307.000|20110106155309.000|TR0|elements of the Constitution which justify 
20110106155309.000|20110106155311.000|TR0|why some of us fight for programs in the 
20110106155311.000|20110106155312.000|TR0|Congress will not be written in the 
20110106155312.000|20110106155314.000|TR0|dedacted version, it is of consequence to 
20110106155314.000|20110106155316.000|TR0|who we are.
20110106155316.000|20110106155318.000|TR0|
20110106155318.000|20110106155320.000|TR0|Thank you, Mr. Speaker.
20110106155320.000|20110106155321.000|TR0|
20110106155321.000|20110106155323.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I thank the gentleman for his 
20110106155323.000|20110106155325.000|TR0|comments, and I take them very much to 
20110106155325.000|20110106155327.000|TR0|heart, as has our leadership.  In fact, in

20110106155328.000|20110106155330.000|TR0|mentioned in my comments that only two 
20110106155330.000|20110106155332.000|TR0|members would be recognized out of order 
20110106155332.000|20110106155334.000|TR0|to read sections.  One is the gentleman 
20110106155334.000|20110106155336.000|TR0|from Texas, Mr. Smith, the chairman of the 
20110106155336.000|20110106155337.000|TR0|Judiciary Committee, who will read the 
20110106155337.000|20110106155339.000|TR0|first article of section three, dealing

20110106155413.000|20110106155415.000|TR0|yield for that purpose, without objection?
20110106155415.000|20110106155417.000|TR0|
20110106155417.000|20110106155418.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I yield.
20110106155418.000|20110106155420.000|TR0|
20110106155420.000|20110106155422.000|TR0|Out of the same deference and respect for 
20110106155422.000|20110106155424.000|TR0|this document that we revere, I think it's 
20110106155424.000|20110106155426.000|TR0|important that we use the language of the 
20110106155426.000|20110106155427.000|TR0|Constitution itself.  They are not 
20110106155427.000|20110106155429.000|TR0|deletions, they are amendments.
20110106155429.000|20110106155431.000|TR0|
20110106155431.000|20110106155433.000|TR0|And in that respect, we go by the amended 
20110106155433.000|20110106155435.000|TR0|document, not by the deleted document.  
20110106155435.000|20110106155436.000|TR0|There are too many that fought and died 
20110106155436.000|20110106155438.000|TR0|for those amendments to call them 
20110106155438.000|20110106155440.000|TR0|deletions.
20110106155440.000|20110106155442.000|TR0|
20110106155442.000|20110106155443.000|TR0|With that, I yield back.
20110106155443.000|20110106155445.000|TR0|
20110106155445.000|20110106155447.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  It is an amended document, but 
20110106155447.000|20110106155449.000|TR0|we are going to read the document as 
20110106155449.000|20110106155451.000|TR0|amended.
20110106155451.000|20110106155452.000|TR0|

20110106155454.000|20110106155456.000|TR0|advance for their participation in this 
20110106155456.000|20110106155458.000|TR0|historic event.  I thank the leadership 
20110106155458.000|20110106155500.000|TR0|and members for providing for this reading 
20110106155500.000|20110106155501.000|TR0|in the rules of the House.
20110106155501.000|20110106155503.000|TR0|
20110106155503.000|20110106155505.000|TR0|It is now my distinct honor to yield to 
20110106155505.000|20110106155507.000|TR0|the Speaker of the House to begin the 
20110106155507.000|20110106155508.000|TR0|reading.
20110106155508.000|20110106155510.000|TR0|
20110106155510.000|20110106155512.000|TR0|REP. JOHN BOEHNER (R), SPEAKER OF THE 
20110106155512.000|20110106155514.000|TR0|HOUSE:  "We the people of the United 
20110106155514.000|20110106155516.000|TR0|States, in order to form a more perfect 
20110106155516.000|20110106155517.000|TR0|union, establish justice, ensure domestic 
20110106155517.000|20110106155519.000|TR0|tranquility, provide for the common 
20110106155519.000|20110106155521.000|TR0|defense, promote the general welfare, and 
20110106155521.000|20110106155523.000|TR0|secure the blessings of liberty to 
20110106155523.000|20110106155525.000|TR0|ourselves and our posterity, do ordain and 
20110106155525.000|20110106155526.000|TR0|establish this Constitution for the United 
20110106155526.000|20110106155528.000|TR0|States of America."
20110106155528.000|20110106155530.000|TR0|
20110106155530.000|20110106155532.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the minority 
20110106155532.000|20110106155533.000|TR0|leader, the gentlewoman from California, 
20110106155533.000|20110106155535.000|TR0|Ms. Pelosi.
20110106155535.000|20110106155537.000|TR0|
20110106155537.000|20110106155539.000|TR0|REP. NANCY PELOSI (D-CA), MINORITY LEADER: 
20110106155539.000|20110106155541.000|TR0| Article 1, Section 1: "All legislative 
20110106155541.000|20110106155542.000|TR0|powers herein granted shall be vested in a 
20110106155542.000|20110106155544.000|TR0|Congress of the United States which shall 
20110106155544.000|20110106155546.000|TR0|consist of a Senate and a House of 
20110106155546.000|20110106155548.000|TR0|Representatives."
20110106155548.000|20110106155550.000|TR0|
20110106155550.000|20110106155551.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the majority 
20110106155551.000|20110106155553.000|TR0|leader, the gentleman from Virginia, Mr. 
20110106155553.000|20110106155555.000|TR0|Cantor.       REP. ERIC CANTOR (R-VA), 
20110106155555.000|20110106155557.000|TR0|MAJORITY LEADER:  Article 1, Section 2: 
20110106155557.000|20110106155558.000|TR0|"The House of Representatives shall be 
20110106155558.000|20110106155600.000|TR0|composed of members chosen every second 
20110106155600.000|20110106155602.000|TR0|year by the people of the several states, 
20110106155602.000|20110106155604.000|TR0|and the electors in each state shall have 
20110106155604.000|20110106155606.000|TR0|the qualifications requisite for electors 
20110106155606.000|20110106155607.000|TR0|of the most numerous branch of the state 
20110106155607.000|20110106155609.000|TR0|legislature.  No person shall be a 
20110106155609.000|20110106155611.000|TR0|representative who shall not have attained 
20110106155611.000|20110106155613.000|TR0|to the age of 25 years and been seven 
20110106155613.000|20110106155615.000|TR0|years a citizen of the United States, and 
20110106155615.000|20110106155616.000|TR0|who shall not, when elected, be an 
20110106155616.000|20110106155618.000|TR0|inhabitant of the state in which he shall 
20110106155618.000|20110106155620.000|TR0|be chosen.  The actual enumeration shall 
20110106155620.000|20110106155622.000|TR0|be made within three years after the first 
20110106155622.000|20110106155623.000|TR0|meeting of the Congress of the United 
20110106155623.000|20110106155625.000|TR0|States, and within every subsequent term 
20110106155625.000|20110106155627.000|TR0|of 10 years in such manner as they shall 
20110106155627.000|20110106155629.000|TR0|by law direct."
20110106155629.000|20110106155631.000|TR0|
20110106155631.000|20110106155632.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the minority 
20110106155632.000|20110106155634.000|TR0|whip, the gentleman from Maryland, Mr. 
20110106155634.000|20110106155636.000|TR0|Hoyer.
20110106155636.000|20110106155638.000|TR0|
20110106155638.000|20110106155640.000|TR0|REP. STENY HOYER (D-MD), MINORITY WHIP:  
20110106155640.000|20110106155641.000|TR0|Article 1, continuation of Section 2: "The 
20110106155641.000|20110106155643.000|TR0|number of representatives shall not exceed 
20110106155643.000|20110106155645.000|TR0|one for every 30,000, but each state shall 
20110106155645.000|20110106155647.000|TR0|have at least one representative. And 
20110106155647.000|20110106155648.000|TR0|until such enumeration shall be made, the 
20110106155648.000|20110106155650.000|TR0|state of New Hampshire shall been entitled 
20110106155650.000|20110106155652.000|TR0|to choose three; Massachusetts, eight;, 
20110106155652.000|20110106155654.000|TR0|Rhode Island and Providence Plantations, 
20110106155654.000|20110106155656.000|TR0|one; Connecticut, five; New York, six; New 
20110106155656.000|20110106155657.000|TR0|Jersey, four; Pennsylvania, eight; 
20110106155657.000|20110106155659.000|TR0|Delaware, one; Maryland, six;, Virginia, 
20110106155659.000|20110106155701.000|TR0|10; North Carolina, five; South Carolina, 
20110106155701.000|20110106155703.000|TR0|five; and Georgia, three."
20110106155703.000|20110106155705.000|TR0|
20110106155705.000|20110106155706.000|TR0|"When vacancies happen in the 
20110106155706.000|20110106155708.000|TR0|representation from any state, the 
20110106155708.000|20110106155710.000|TR0|executive authority thereof shall issue 
20110106155710.000|20110106155712.000|TR0|writs of election to fill such vacancies.  
20110106155712.000|20110106155713.000|TR0|The House of Representatives shall choose 
20110106155713.000|20110106155715.000|TR0|their Speaker and other officers, and 
20110106155715.000|20110106155717.000|TR0|shall have the sole power of impeachment."
20110106155717.000|20110106155719.000|TR0|
20110106155719.000|20110106155721.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the gentleman 
20110106155721.000|20110106155722.000|TR0|from California, the majority whip, Mr. 
20110106155722.000|20110106155724.000|TR0|McCarthy.
20110106155724.000|20110106155726.000|TR0|
20110106155726.000|20110106155728.000|TR0|REP. KEVIN MCCARTHY (R-CA), CALIFORNIA:  
20110106155728.000|20110106155730.000|TR0|Article 1, Section 3: "The Senate of the 
20110106155730.000|20110106155731.000|TR0|United States shall be composed of two 
20110106155731.000|20110106155733.000|TR0|senators from each state for six years, 
20110106155733.000|20110106155735.000|TR0|and each senator shall have one vote. 
20110106155735.000|20110106155737.000|TR0|Immediately after, they shall be assembled 
20110106155737.000|20110106155738.000|TR0|in consequence of the first election.  
20110106155738.000|20110106155740.000|TR0|They shall be divided as equally as may be 
20110106155740.000|20110106155742.000|TR0|into three classes."
20110106155742.000|20110106155744.000|TR0|
20110106155744.000|20110106155746.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the gentleman 
20110106155746.000|20110106155747.000|TR0|from New Jersey, Mr. Rothman.
20110106155747.000|20110106155749.000|TR0|
20110106155749.000|20110106155751.000|TR0|I would ask members to read the page right 
20110106155751.000|20110106155753.000|TR0|in front of them and not continue.
20110106155753.000|20110106155755.000|TR0|
20110106155755.000|20110106155756.000|TR0|REP. STEVE ROTHMAN (D), NEW JERSEY:  "The 
20110106155756.000|20110106155758.000|TR0|seats of the senators of the first class 
20110106155758.000|20110106155800.000|TR0|shall be vacated at the expiration of the 
20110106155800.000|20110106155802.000|TR0|second year; of the second class, at the 
20110106155802.000|20110106155803.000|TR0|expiration of the fourth year; and of the 
20110106155803.000|20110106155805.000|TR0|third class, at the expiration of the 
20110106155805.000|20110106155807.000|TR0|sixth year, so that one third may be 
20110106155807.000|20110106155809.000|TR0|chosen every second year."
20110106155809.000|20110106155811.000|TR0|
20110106155811.000|20110106155812.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the gentleman 
20110106155812.000|20110106155814.000|TR0|from Texas, Mr. Conaway.
20110106155814.000|20110106155816.000|TR0|
20110106155816.000|20110106155818.000|TR0|REP. MIKE CONAWAY (R), TEXAS:  "No person 
20110106155818.000|20110106155820.000|TR0|shall be a senator who shall not have 
20110106155820.000|20110106155821.000|TR0|attained to the age of 30s and have been 
20110106155821.000|20110106155823.000|TR0|nine years a citizen of the United States, 
20110106155823.000|20110106155825.000|TR0|and who shall not, when elected, be an 
20110106155825.000|20110106155827.000|TR0|inhabitant of that state for which he 
20110106155827.000|20110106155828.000|TR0|shall be chosen."
20110106155828.000|20110106155830.000|TR0|
20110106155830.000|20110106155832.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the gentleman 
20110106155832.000|20110106155834.000|TR0|from Georgia, Mr. Scott.
20110106155834.000|20110106155836.000|TR0|
20110106155836.000|20110106155837.000|TR0|REP. DAVID SCOTT (D), GEORGIA:  "The vice 
20110106155837.000|20110106155839.000|TR0|president of the United States, but shall 
20110106155839.000|20110106155841.000|TR0|not have no vote unless they be equally 
20110106155841.000|20110106155843.000|TR0|divided. The Senate shall choose their 
20110106155843.000|20110106155845.000|TR0|other officers, and also a president pro 
20110106155845.000|20110106155846.000|TR0|tempore in the absence of the vice 
20110106155846.000|20110106155848.000|TR0|president, or when he shall exercise the 
20110106155848.000|20110106155850.000|TR0|office of president of the United States."
20110106155850.000|20110106155852.000|TR0|
20110106155852.000|20110106155853.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the gentleman 
20110106155853.000|20110106155855.000|TR0|from Michigan, Mr. Walberg.
20110106155855.000|20110106155857.000|TR0|
20110106155857.000|20110106155859.000|TR0|REP. TIMOTHY WALBERG (R), MICHIGAN:  "The 
20110106155859.000|20110106155901.000|TR0|Senate shall have the sole power to try 
20110106155901.000|20110106155902.000|TR0|all impeachments.  In setting for that 
20110106155902.000|20110106155904.000|TR0|purpose, they shall be on oath or 
20110106155904.000|20110106155906.000|TR0|affirmation.  When the president of the 
20110106155906.000|20110106155908.000|TR0|United States is tried, the chief justice 
20110106155908.000|20110106155910.000|TR0|shall preside, and no person shall be 
20110106155910.000|20110106155911.000|TR0|convicted without the concurrence of 
20110106155911.000|20110106155913.000|TR0|two-thirds of the members present."
20110106155913.000|20110106155915.000|TR0|
20110106155915.000|20110106155917.000|TR0|GOODLATTE:  I now yield to the gentleman 
20110106155917.000|20110106155918.000|TR0|from Pennsylvania, Mr.
20110106155918.000|20110106155920.000|TR0|
20110106155920.000|20110106155922.000|TR0|REP. MARK CRITZ (D), PENNSYLVANIA:  
20110106155922.000|20110106155924.000|TR0|"Judgment in cases of impeachment shall 
20110106155924.000|20110106155926.000|TR0|not extend further than to removal from 
20110106155926.000|20110106155927.000|TR0|office and disqualification to hold and 
20110106155927.000|20110106155929.000|TR0|enjoy any office of honor, trust or profit 
20110106155929.000|20110106155931.000|TR0|under the United States.  But the party 
20110106155931.000|20110106155933.000|TR0|convicted shall, nevertheless, be liable 
20110106155933.000|20110106155935.000|TR0|and subject to indictment, trial, 
20110106155935.000|20110106155936.000|TR0|judgment, and punishment, according to 
20110106155936.000|20110106155938.000|TR0|law."
20110106155938.000|20110106155940.000|TR0|
20110106155940.000|20110106155942.000|TR0|(END OF COVERAGE)
